articles.title: 139 Genes Set Human Cognitive Ability Apart From Other Primates - Technology Networks
articles.description: A group of 139 genes commonly expressed in primate brains – which underwent evolutionary divergence only in human brains – may be the source of our unique cognitive abilities according to a study led by the University of Toronto.
